info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 1:33PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Lincoln, northwestern Mecklenburg, southeastern Cleveland, Gaston and north central York Counties through 200 PM EDT... At 133 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of Gastonia, or near Kings Mountain, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gastonia, Huntersville, Kings Mountain, Mt Holly, Bessemer City, South Gastonia, Dallas, Stanley, Lowell and Ranlo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
